meanings.definition: The quality or state of being interchangeable.
meanings.sent1: The interchangeability of these parts makes assembly easy.
meanings.sent2: The store offers a wide range of products with interchangeability.
meanings.sent3: The mix-up at the costume party highlighted the interchangeability of the superhero costumes.
meanings.sent4: In the world of fashion, trends show the interchangeability of styles over time.
meanings.sent5: The puzzle pieces demonstrated the concept of interchangeability perfectly.

meanings.definition: The ability to be exchanged or substituted for one another.
meanings.sent1: The interchangeability of currencies simplifies international trade.
meanings.sent2: The software allows for interchangeability between different file formats.
meanings.sent3: The interchangeable keys on the keyboard led to a playful mix-up during the typing competition.
meanings.sent4: In the orchestra, each musician's role showcases the interchangeability of instruments in creating harmony.
meanings.sent5: The interchangeable parts of the toy robot sparked creativity in building new designs.
